intro: Ceanothus jepsonii var. albiflorus, commonly known as Whiteflower Ceanothus, is a shrub native to California. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, often in coastal or inland mountainous regions. It is part of the Rhamnaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sensitive species.
